intro: Piptanthocereus alacriportanus, commonly known as the rare desert cactus, is a species native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its spiny, cylindrical stems that store water, adapting to arid environments. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom during the warmer months. Its root system is shallow and spreads widely to maximize water absorption. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
